channel.title: Project Gateway on
channel.description: Recent content in Project Gateway on

item.title: Enable Project Gateway
item.description:
This section introduces how to enable project gateways.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Project Gateway Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Project Gateway Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Enable Gateway on the right side of the page.

  4. In the pop-up dialog box, set the parameters for the gateway, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Nginx Ingress Version

item.title: View Project Gateway Information
item.description:
This section introduces how to view project gateway information.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Project Gateway Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Project Gateway Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

    The Gateway Settings page provides the following information:

item.title: View Project Gateway Details
item.description:
This section introduces how to view project gateway details.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Project Gateway Viewing permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Project Gateway Viewing permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > View Details to open the gateway details page.

  4. On the gateway details page, view the resource attributes of the gateway in the Attributes area on the left.

    Parameter Description

    Cluster

item.title: Edit Project Gateway Settings
item.description:
This section introduces how to edit project gateway settings.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Project Gateway Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Project Gateway Management permission, and access your project.

  2. Click Project Settings > Gateway Settings in the left navigation pane.

  3. On the right side of the page, select Manage > Edit.

  4. In the pop-up dialog box, modify the parameters of the gateway, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    IngressClassName

item.title: Disable Project Gateway
item.description:
This section introduces how to disable project gateways.

Warning

After disabling the gateway, clients will not be able to access the services reverse-proxied by the gateway, and related business may be interrupted. Please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

  • KubeSphere Gateway should have been installed and enabled.

  • You should join a project and have the Project Gateway Management permission within the project. For more information, refer to "Project Members" and "Project Roles".
